snippet: St. Louis police officials said on Tuesday that Vonderrit D. Myers Jr., the black teenager who was fatally shot by a white off-duty police officer on Oct. 8, had gunshot residue on his hands, jeans and T-shirt, supporting the officer’s assertion...
abstract: St Louis police officials report that Vonderrit D Myers Jr, black teenager who was fatally shot by white off-duty police officer, had gunshot residue on him; statement supports the officer’s assertion that Myers had shot at him.
lead_paragraph: St. Louis police officials said on Tuesday that Vonderrit D. Myers Jr., the black teenager who was fatally shot by a white off-duty police officer on Oct. 8, had gunshot residue on his hands, jeans and T-shirt, supporting the officer’s assertion that Mr. Myers had shot at him.

headline.main: Missouri: Police Link Dead Teenager to Gunfire
headline.print_headline: Missouri: New Evidence in Fatal St. Louis Shooting
